edu.vtc.cis3310.checkers
Class CheckerBoard

java.lang.Object
  edu.vtc.cis3310.checkers.CheckerBoard

public class CheckerBoard
extends java.lang.Object

CheckerBoard - a basic implementation of the board for a checkers game. Provides the basic mechanisms of the game, including lists of legal moves.

Author:
Craig A. Damon

Constructor Summary
CheckerBoard()
          create a checkboard in the legal starting state

Method Detail

getPiece

public Piece getPiece(int n)
get the piece at position n on the board

Parameters:
n - from 1-32. Numbers 1-4 are the back row of the red starting side, from Red's right to left.
Returns:
the piece or null if no piece is there

legalMoves

public java.util.Collection<Move> legalMoves(Color turn)
give a list of all the legal moves for a player.

Parameters:
turn - the color of the player whose turn it is
Returns:
the moves, in no particular order

Returns:

isKingRow

public static boolean isKingRow(Color color,
                                int pos)
is the indicated position on the king row for the indicated color

Parameters:
color - the color of the piece in question
pos - the position on the board, in standard 1-32 notation
Returns:
true if the position is a king row, false if notr

capturePos

public static int capturePos(int startPos,
                             int endPos)
what position is jumped over in the indicated jump (the position where the captured piece was)

Parameters:
startPos - the position of the jumping piece before the jump in 1-32 notation
endPos - the ending position of the jumping piece after the jump, in 1-32 notation
Returns:
the position jumped over, in 1-32 notation

advanceLeft

public static int advanceLeft(Color color,
                              int pos)
give the position that would be moved in the indicated color moved forward-left from the indicated position

Parameters:
color - the color that defines the forward direction to be moved
pos - the position to move from, in standard 1-32 notation
Returns:
the final position, in 1-32 notation or -1 if no left move can be made because of a side or end of the board

advanceRight

public static int advanceRight(Color color,
                               int pos)
give the position that would be moved in the indicated color moved forward-right from the indicated position

Parameters:
color - the color that defines the forward direction to be moved
pos - the position to move from, in standard 1-32 notation
Returns:
the final position, in 1-32 notation or -1 if no right move can be made because of a side or end of the board

jumpLeft

public static int jumpLeft(Color color,
                           int pos)
give the position that would be jumped to in the forward direction of the indicated color. This just computes the space two spaces forward-left diagonally, ignoring whether pieces are in the place to allow the jump.

Parameters:
color - the color that defines the forward direction to be jumped
pos - the position to jump from, in standard 1-32 notation
Returns:
the final position, in 1-32 notation or -1 if no left jump can be made because of a side or end of the board

jumpRight

public static int jumpRight(Color color,
                            int pos)
give the position that would be jumped to in the forward direction of the indicated color. This just computes the space two spaces forward-right diagonally, ignoring whether pieces are in the place to allow the jump.

Parameters:
color - the color that defines the forward direction to be jumped
pos - the position to jump from, in standard 1-32 notation
Returns:
the final position, in 1-32 notation or -1 if no right jump can be made because of a side or end of the board

run a simple text of the board

args -
